events.text: You seem a lot more optimistic than the rest.
Why is that?
I’ve always been that way really.
It’s something that’s helped a lot when meeting new people before and after the explosion.
I’m sure you didn’t mean any harm when you did what you did.
I honestly believe that.
Giving people a second chance isn’t something that comes often anymore, but you never know what you might learn if you’re willing to listen.
I’m just here to help remind the team that every now and again before they’re at each other’s throats.
Thanks, I appreciate it.
We’ll get through this.
Humanity’s ability to persevere is amazing wouldn’t you say?
Team? I was held at gunpoint when I was ‘asked’ to join you guys.
Doing my part and getting out of here is all I care about.
I couldn’t care less if you guys or the rest of the planet died.
Don’t exactly blame you for feeling that way.
I told Alistair that was a really bad idea. Heh heh heh...
What matters is that you’re still willing to do your part to help.
That’s all I can really ask from you anyway.

events.choice: Why are you with Gaia's Advocates?

events.text: Being an environmentalist is one thing, but joining Gaia’s Advocates…
I heard about them being extremist while I was in prison. Why join them?
Do I really come off that much of a tree hugger?
A little bit of a softy for a terrorist is more like it.
HA HA HA HA!
Quite the conundrum I’m in then, eh?
Helping Gaia’s Advocates heal the planet helps everyone at the end of the day.
I can’t speak on how the other factions of Gaia operate, but…
Who could really be against helping the earth and its creatures?
What's your skill then?
Being a conversationalist goes a long way when trying to get information.
I bring more to interactions than you might get with our other teammates.
Taking a not so aggressive stance normally makes you seem as nice as me and just might get people to open up more.
What kind of information we get will depend on what you bring to the table and that I can’t control.
Combat wise, I use a rifle, so I typically cover our other members when they’re on the offense.
Keep in mind, my shots are limited based on how much ammo we have.
If no one is on the offensive it can leave me vulnerable.
And if I am attacked, I’m not altered like everyone else, so I’m not the strongest of the bunch, unfortunately.
That’s not good...
Think of it this way.
You scratch my back and I’ll scratch yours.
If that makes any sense.
Alright, I’m counting on you. Let’s make the earth a better place.

metadata.name: 1.2.2 Getting to Know Your Team Leo
